results.claim: Albert Einstein is widely regarded as one of the most influential scientists of the twentieth century.
results.explanation: Contains vague terms: most. Cannot verify.

results.claim: He published the theory of general relativity in 1915.
key_facts: On November 25, 1915, Einstein submitted one of the most remarkable scientific papers of the twentieth century to the Prussian Academy of Sciences in Berlin.
Einstein’s General Theory of Relativity presented the final form of what are called the Einstein Equations, the field equations of gravity which underpin Einstein’s theory.

results.claim: The Amazon River is often described as one of the longest rivers in the world.
results.explanation: Contains vague terms: often. Cannot verify.

results.claim: It is frequently claimed that the Amazon is the longest river on Earth, surpassing the Nile in total length.
results.correction: The Amazon is not the longest river on Earth; it is second in length only to the Nile.
key_facts: The Amazon is second in length only to the Nile.
97 percent of all water is contained in the South America - Andes, Peaks, Glaciers region.

results.claim: This assertion depends on measurement methods and remains debated.

results.claim: Uranium-235 is a commonly used fuel in nuclear reactors.
key_facts: Uranium-235 is an isotope of uranium making up about 0.72% of natural uranium.
Uranium-235 has a half-life of 704 million years.

results.claim: Nuclear energy produces zero radioactive waste.
results.correction: Nuclear energy does produce radioactive waste, but its management is a significant challenge.
key_facts: While significant progress has been made in reducing the volume of final radioactive waste...
nuclear waste is often perceived as immediately lethal, but exposure risks are managed with proper safety protocols.
